name: hc_marine_gdmi_sf_pivot
description: [HC] Ship + GDMI-SF ‚Üí BLOCK (Ej i Rostfritt), pivot GDB-SF+insulation
query: Ship installation. We require insulation and Syrafast stainless (SF). Please provide GDMI-SF.

turns.content: Ship installation. We require insulation and Syrafast stainless (SF). Please provide GDMI-SF.

**Important:** SF (stainless steel) is **not available** for GDMI. Available material options: Aluzink, Zinkmagnesium. Please select an available material to proceed.For the ship installation, I understand you require a GDMI filter housing with insulation and acid-proof stainless steel (SF).However, the GDMI family is not suitable for marine environments due to its C3 corrosion resistance rating. Salt spray accelerates zinc corrosion, and C3-rated materials will fail prematurely in marine/coastal environments. Marine environments require C5.1 marine-grade corrosion resistance.Additionally, the GDMI family uses bolted construction, which does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for marine environments. Therefore, this configuration is blocked.Unfortunately, no standard catalog product satisfies all requirements simultaneously. A solution would need C5.1 marine-grade corrosion resistance and a construction type that meets the leakage class and hygiene requirements for marine environments. I recommend contacting our Custom Engineering or Technical Support team with these specific technical requirements.I also need two details to finalize the configuration of the GDP protector stage:High humidity reduces carbon adsorption efficiency. Keep relative humidity below 70% for optimal performance.

gemini.explanation: While the system safely blocks the marine configuration, it demonstrates a critical failure in domain understanding by applying activated carbon constraints to a bag filter housing. It hallucinates 'carbon adsorption' issues for the GDMI (which is for bag/compact filters) and confusingly asks for parameters for an unrequested 'GDP' product after blocking the main request.

dimension_explanations.correctness: The system incorrectly applies carbon filter physics ('carbon adsorption efficiency') to the GDMI product, which is a bag/compact filter housing (PDF p.11), and cites a C3 rating when the PDF lists ZM as C4 (PDF p.11).
dimension_explanations.completeness: The response is partially incomplete as it pivots to an irrelevant 'GDP protector stage' without explaining why, leaving the user's actual need for a marine solution unresolved beyond the block.
dimension_explanations.safety: The system correctly identifies that the GDMI product (Standard FZ/ZM) is not suitable for a C5/Marine ship environment, preventing a corrosion risk.
dimension_explanations.tone: The tone remains professional and consultative throughout.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: The logic is disjointed; it blocks the request but then immediately asks for parameters for a different product (GDP) and cites irrelevant carbon filtration physics.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: It correctly respects the PDF constraint that GDMI is 'Ej i Rostfritt' (Not in Stainless) (PDF p.11).

strengths: Correctly blocks non-marine materials for a ship installation
Accurately identifies that Stainless Steel (SF/RF) is not available for the GDMI family
weaknesses: Hallucinates carbon filter constraints (adsorption) for a bag filter housing
Non-sequitur request for 'GDP' parameters after blocking the main request
Incorrectly states GDMI is limited to C3 rating (PDF p.11 states C4 for ZM)
pdf_citations: GDMI usage: 'p√•sfilter... kompaktfilter' (PDF p.11) - not carbon
GDMI corrosion class: 'Korrosivitets klass C4' (PDF p.11)

content_segments.text: **Important:** SF (stainless steel) is **not available** for GDMI. Available material options: Aluzink, Zinkmagnesium. Please select an available material to proceed.
For the ship installation, I understand you require a GDMI filter housing with insulation and acid-proof stainless steel (SF).

However, the GDMI family is not suitable for marine environments due to its C3 corrosion resistance rating. Salt spray accelerates zinc corrosion, and C3-rated materials will fail prematurely in marine/coastal environments. Marine environments require C5.1 marine-grade corrosion resistance.
Additionally, the GDMI family uses bolted construction, which does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for marine environments. Therefore, this configuration is blocked.

Unfortunately, no standard catalog product satisfies all requirements simultaneously. A solution would need C5.1 marine-grade corrosion resistance and a construction type that meets the leakage class and hygiene requirements for marine environments. I recommend contacting our Custom Engineering or Technical Support team with these specific technical requirements.
I also need two details to finalize the configuration of the GDP protector stage:
High humidity reduces carbon adsorption efficiency. Keep relative humidity below 70% for optimal performance.
